get.description:
List all available features and their subfeatures.

Returns a simple dictionary mapping feature names to lists of subfeature names.

schema.title: Response List Features V3 Info Get

get.description:
List all subfeatures for a specific feature.

Args:
    feature: Feature name (e.g., 'text', 'image', 'ocr', 'translation')

Returns:
    Dictionary with feature name and list of its subfeatures.

schema.title: Response List Subfeatures V3 Info  Feature  Get

get.description:
Get detailed information for a specific feature/subfeature.

Args:
    feature: Feature name (e.g., 'text', 'image', 'ocr', 'translation')
    subfeature: Subfeature name (e.g., 'ai_detection', 'ocr', 'generation')
    format: Schema output format (simplified or json_schema)

Returns:
    - Input schema
    - Output schema
    - Available providers and their models

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Schema format: 'simplified' for flat readable format, 'json_schema' for full Pydantic JSON Schema

parameters.description: Schema format: 'simplified' for flat readable format, 'json_schema' for full Pydantic JSON Schema

schema.title: Response Get Feature Info V3 Info  Feature   Subfeature  Get

get.description: List available LLM models with extended metadata.

post.description:
Universal AI endpoint for all non-LLM AI features.

Model format: feature/subfeature/provider[/model]

Request body:
- model: Model string in format feature/subfeature/provider[/model]
- input: Feature-specific input parameters
- provider_params: Optional provider-specific parameters
- show_original_response: Include raw provider response (default: false)

Example:
```json
{
    "model": "text/ai_detection/openai/gpt-4",
    "input": {"text": "Analyze this text"}
}
```

Response:
```json
{
    "status": "success",
    "cost": "0.001",
    "provider": "openai",
    "feature": "text",
    "subfeature": "ai_detection",
    "output": {...},
    "error": null
}
```

Upload a file for persistent storage.

Returns a file_id that can be used in subsequent API calls to /v3/universal-ai.

Files are stored securely and only accessible by the file owner.
Default expiration is 30 days, maximum 30 days.

get.description:
List uploaded files for the authenticated user.

Optionally filter by purpose. Only returns non-expired files.
Results are ordered by creation date (newest first).

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of items per page
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of items per page

delete.description:
Delete all uploaded files for the authenticated user.

This permanently deletes all files from storage.
This action cannot be undone.

post.description:
Delete specific files by their IDs.

Only files owned by the authenticated user will be deleted.
Files that don't exist or aren't owned by the user are silently ignored.
This action cannot be undone.

file_ids.title: File Ids
file_ids.description: List of file IDs to delete (1-100)

DeleteFilesRequest.title: DeleteFilesRequest
DeleteFilesRequest.description: Request body for deleting multiple files.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: Unique file identifier for use in API calls

ListFilesResponse.title: ListFilesResponse
ListFilesResponse.description: Response for listing files with pagination.

model.title: Model
model.description: The name of the LLM model to use.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The messages to send to the LLM model.

router_candidates.title: Router Candidates
router_candidates.description: List of model candidates for dynamic routing when using model='@edenai'. If not provided, defaults to all available models.

n.title: N
n.description: The number of completions to generate for each prompt. Defaults to 1.

reasoning_effort.title: Reasoning Effort
reasoning_effort.description: The reasoning effort level for the LLM model.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description:
list of metadata associated with the chat request. 
Can be used to provide additional context or tracking information.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Penalty for repeated tokens in the output.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description: Logit bias to influence token generation.

logprobs.title: Logprobs
logprobs.description: Whether to include log probabilities of tokens in the output. Defaults to False.

top_logprobs.title: Top Logprobs
top_logprobs.description: Number of top log probabilities to return with each token.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion

max_completion_tokens.title: Max Completion Tokens
max_completion_tokens.description: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion, including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens.

modalities.title: Modalities
modalities.description: List of supported input/output modalities for the chat.

audio.title: Audio
audio.description: dictionary for audio-related parameters or metadata.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Penalty for new tokens based on their presence in the text so far.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: Specify the desired response format for the completion.

service_tier.title: Service Tier
service_tier.description:
'auto': Automatically select appropriate tier
'default': Use the default service tier

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: List of stop sequences to end the generation.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: Whether to stream the response in real-time. Defaults to False.

stream_options.title: Stream Options
stream_options.description: Options for streaming responses, such as chunk size or format.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Sampling temperature for controlling randomness in output.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: Nucleus sampling parameter for controlling diversity in output. Defaults to 1.0.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: List of tools that can be used by the model to assist in generating responses.

tool_choice.title: Tool Choice
tool_choice.description: Specify how tools should be used. Can be 'auto', 'required', 'none', or an object like {'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'tool_name'}} to force a specific tool.

parallel_tool_calls.title: Parallel Tool Calls
parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow parallel tool calls in the completion.

user.title: User
user.description: User identifier for tracking or personalization purposes.

function_call.title: Function Call
function_call.description: Function call parameters for invoking specific functions during the chat.

functions.title: Functions
functions.description: List of functions that can be called by the model to assist in generating responses.

thinking.title: Thinking
thinking.description: Parameters related to the model's reasoning or thinking process.

web_search_options.title: Web Search Options
web_search_options.description: Options for web search integration. Example: json web_search_options={ "search_context_size": "medium" # Options: "low", "medium", "high" }

verbosity.title: Verbosity
verbosity.description: Hint the model to be more or less expansive in its replies. Values: "low", "medium", "high". low (gpt5 models)

role.title: Role
role.description: The role of the message sender (e.g., 'user', 'assistant').

content.title: Content
content.description: The content of the message, either text or image.

file_data.title: File Data
file_data.description: The file data in base64 format.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: File identifier: either a UUID from /v3/upload endpoint or an HTTP(S) URL.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text content of the message.

ModelObject.title: ModelObject
ModelObject.description: Extended model object with full metadata.

function.description: The function to force the model to call.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the function to call.

input.title: Input

examples.text: Analyze this text for AI detection

show_original_response.title: Show Original Response
show_original_response.description: Include raw provider response in the output

UniversalAIBody.title: UniversalAIBody
UniversalAIBody.description:
Universal AI request body.

Model format: feature/subfeature/provider[/model]

Examples:
    - text/ai_detection/openai/gpt-4
    - ocr/ocr/amazon
    - image/generation/google/imagen-3

The `input` dict contains feature-specific parameters that are
validated at runtime based on the parsed feature/subfeature.

status.title: Status
status.description: Whether the request succeeded or failed

cost.title: Cost
cost.description: Cost in credits for this request

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: Provider name that processed the request

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message from the provider (only present when status is 'fail')

original_response.title: Original Response
original_response.description: Raw response from the provider (if show_original_response=true)

UniversalAIResponse.title: UniversalAIResponse
UniversalAIResponse.description:
Normalized response from universal-ai endpoint.

All responses have a consistent structure regardless of the feature/subfeature.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: Unique file identifier for use in API calls

UploadResponse.title: UploadResponse
UploadResponse.description: Response for a successful file upload.
